intro: Erigeron provancheri, commonly known as the Sierra dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces dandelion-like yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many composite flowers. Erigeron provancheri is typically herbaceous, with a short, unbranched stem that supports its flowering head.
